projects.title: Marleys Projects
projects.description: See Marley Mulvin Broome's software projects

home.title: Hi, I'm Marley
home.description: Software Engineer & Sigma Male based in Osaka, Japan

home-call.description: A solution for nursing home visitations, bookings, and short stays.
home-call.interested: Interested? Check out the home page.
home-call.tech-stack-description: Home call has two product versions: a cloud and a desktop version. The cloud version is currently the only version which will be supported in the future, but a legacy desktop version was and still is in use by some users.
home-call.data-management-content: Home Call uses a relational database to store information about a nursing homes visitors, residents, bookings, visitor history, and much more.
home-call.notifications-content: The desktop application exposes a server to the local network, allowing for clients to connect and listen to notifications over a websocket. Moreover, the server also exposes websites for checking in and listening to notifications. There is also a dedicated client for listening to notifications.
home-call.updates-description: The desktop application is autoupdated when new releases are pushed to the private release repository. This is a safe and smooth way of keeping our users up to date and secure.

short-it.title: Short It
short-it.description: A simple and easy to use URL shortener.
short-it.interested: Interested? Its currently in development so come back in a few weeks...
short-it.tech-stack-description: Short-it is broken into two main services: the frontend and the backend. The frontend is a SvelteKit application, and the backend is a Golang application.

omnia.description: A application suite for making you a native English speaker.
omnia.description-content: Omnia was developed during a Hackathon by myself and 4 other team members. We made an API, frontend web app, chrome extension, and mobile app all within a couple weeks. You can see the launch presentation here.

other.title: Other Projects
other.description: A collection of other not so interesting projects that I have worked on.
other.plantopia-content: A game developed in Unity where you have to keep growing plants before your money runs out! The repository is private but I can show you the code some time as well.
other.shousetu-content: A python library for interacting with the API of syosetu.com and downloading novels. It was initially made to be used in conjunction with jpfreq.
other.svelte-share-content: A group of component libraries for SvelteKit to create share buttons. Currently implemented sharing with Line and X.

jpfreq.title: Japanese Frequency Processor
jpfreq.description: A tool for analysing the frequency of words in a Japanese text.
jpfreq.description-title: Well what the hell is it?
jpfreq.description-content: Jpfreq is a tool for analysing the frequency of words in a Japanese text. It is a command line tool written in Python, and it uses the MeCab library to perform the analysis.

electron-timer.title: Electron Timer
electron-timer.description: An app for easily setting interval timers.
electron-timer.description-content: Electron Timer is a desktop application that allows you to create timers. Each timer can have different intervals, loopss, and sounds. It was created as I lacked the precise timing features I wanted for my study.

about.description: I've been programming since I was 12 years old, and sadly don't seem to be stopping anytime soon. I'm currently on the look out for some short-term internships.

exchange.title: Exchange to Kyoto University
exchange.description: Started my half year exchange program at Kyoto University, Japan, where I majored in Computer Science.

familye.title: Joined Familiye
familye.description: After building homecall, a product that helps nursing homes manage visitations, I started working at Familiye to further develop the product as a cloud-based solution.

pactom.title: Co-Founded Pactom
pactom.description: Alongside one of my friends I met through the various hackathons and meetups, we founded Pactom, a startup that aims to innovate the SaaS sales process through live demos. As CTO, I managed a team of over 5 engineers, designing the product and building the early MVPs.

jlpt.title: Passed JLPT N1
jlpt.description: To be allowed to study at Kyoto university, I had to pass the Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) N1 level. Even though it was my first time ever taking the JLPT, I managed to pass it at only the age of 19.

freelance.title: Began Freelance Software Work
freelance.description: From the start of 2023, I began accepting work from various clients ranging from small marketing agencies to large healthcare facilities.

unsw.title: Started studying at UNSW
unsw.description: I started studying a bachelors of Computer Science at The University of New South Wales, Sydney.
